question: How does the Referee start the game and restart it after half-time?

options.text: By throwing in the ball between two players from each team
By blowing the whistle and throwing the ball to the centre
By throwing in the ball between the two team captains
By bouncing the ball in the centre circle

question: For the throw-in at the start of the game and after half-time, where must the two players from each team (involved in the throw-in) stand?

options.text: Side by side on the half-way line
One behind the other in their own defensive sides of the half-way line

question: When the Referee throws in the ball to start the game or restart after half-time, where must all other players (not the four involved in the throw-in) be?

options.text: In their respective positions behind the 45 m lines
In the centre third of the field

question: After a foul, how is play normally restarted (unless an exception applies)?

options.text: By a free puck or a throw-in where the foul(s) occurred
Always by a free puck from the centre of the 20m line
Always by a throw-in on the half-way line
By a free puck from the 45m line

question: For an Aggressive Foul by a defending player within the large rectangle, from where is the Penalty Puck taken?

options.text: The centre point of the 20m line

question: For a Technical Foul by a defending player within the large rectangle, from where is the Free Puck taken?

options.text: The centre point of the 20m line

question: A defending player commits a foul inside their own 20m line but outside the large rectangle. From where is the Free Puck awarded?

options.text: On the 20m line opposite where the foul occurred
The centre point of the 20m line

question: When a player is fouled immediately after playing the ball away and a score results, what applies?

options.text: The score is disallowed and a free is given where the foul occurred
The score is disallowed and a free is given from the 20m line
A throw-in is given where the foul occurred

question: When a player is fouled immediately after playing the ball away and the ball lands over the endline, from where is the free given?

options.text: On the 20m line opposite the place where the ball crossed the endline
Where the ball crossed the endline

question: When a player is fouled immediately after playing the ball away and the ball lands inside the opponents' 20m line, from where is the free given?

options.text: From the 20m line at the point where the ball crossed this line

question: When play is restarted by a throw-in after a foul within 13m of the sideline, where is the throw-in taken?

options.text: 13m from the sideline and directly infield from where the foul occurred

question: When play is restarted by a throw-in after a foul between the endline and the 20m line, where is the throw-in taken?

options.text: On the 20m line opposite where the foul occurred

question: When opposing players foul simultaneously, how is play restarted?

options.text: By a free puck to the team that was fouled first
By a free puck from the 20m line
By a free puck where the first foul occurred

question: When a Free Puck is being taken, what is the minimum distance all other players (except the taker) must be from the ball before it is struck?
When a Throw-In after a foul(s) is being taken, what is the minimum distance all other players (except those contesting the throw-in) must be before the throw-in is made?
A Penalty Puck may be struck from which of the following?

options.text: Only the centre point of the 20m line
The centre point of the 20m line, or at a point within the semi-circular arc with the ball brought back up to 7m from the 20m line

question: For a Penalty Puck, where must the ball be struck?

options.text: On or outside the 20m line but not inside it (except as allowed in Rule 2.5(b))

question: For a Penalty Puck, how many defending players may stand on the goal-line?
For a Penalty Puck, may the defending player on the goal-line move towards the 20m line before the ball has been struck?
For a Penalty Puck, where must all other players (except the taker) be until the ball has been struck?

options.text: Outside the 20m line and the arc; they shall not cross the 20m line or the arc until the ball has been struck

question: If a defending player(s) fouls before a Penalty Puck is struck and a goal does not result, what may the referee allow?

options.text: The Penalty Puck to be retaken (the taker has the option of retaking or having a point scored stand)

question: For a Free Puck for a Technical Foul committed inside the large rectangle, awarded on the centre point of the 20m line, how many defending players may stand on the goal-line?
For a free puck awarded on the 20m line for a foul committed outside the large rectangle, where must the players defending the free stand?

options.text: A minimum of 13m from the point of award
A minimum of 20m from the point of award; they may not move nearer to that point until the ball has been struck

question: For all free pucks, including penalties, in how many ways may the ball be struck with the hurley?

options.text: Only by striking the ball on the ground
Only by lifting with the hurley at the first attempt and striking with the hurley
Either: (i) lift the ball with the hurley at the first attempt and strike it with the hurley, or (ii) strike the ball on the ground

question: According to Rule 2.5, does 'lifting' the ball with the hurley constitute 'striking' the ball?
If a player taking a free puck or penalty fails to lift the ball at the first attempt, or fails to strike it with the hurley, what must the player do?

options.text: Strike it on the ground without delay
Award the free to the opposing team

question: For a Penalty Puck or other Free Puck awarded on the 20m line, if the taker's initial action causes the ball to marginally cross inside the 20m line, is striking the ball on the ground still allowed?

options.text: No, the free must be retaken

question: When may a player of either side approach nearer than the distance specified in Rule 2.4 (20m for free pucks, 13m for throw-ins)?

options.text: As soon as the referee blows the whistle
Only when the player taking the Free Puck or Penalty Puck delays
When the ball crosses the 20m line

question: When the ball is played over the endline by the team attacking that end or after a score, how is play restarted?

options.text: By a throw-in on the 20m line
By a free puck from the 20m line
By a puck-out from within the small rectangle
By a throw-in at the point where the ball crossed the endline

question: For a puck-out, how shall the player taking it initially play the ball?

options.text: Strike it on the ground only
Take the ball into the hand
Raise it with the hurley and strike only

question: If the player taking a puck-out misses the stroke, what may they do?

options.text: Retake the puck-out from the hand
The ball may be struck on the ground or raised with and struck with the hurley, but not taken into the hand again before striking it
Award a throw-in to the opposition
Take the ball into the hand and retry

question: For a puck-out, where must all players be until the ball has been struck?

options.text: Outside the 20m line, except the goalkeeper and the player taking the puck-out (if other than the goalkeeper)

question: For a puck-out, how far must the ball travel before being played by another player of the defending team?
When the ball is played over the endline and outside the goalposts by the team defending that end, how is play restarted?

options.text: Puck-out from within the small rectangle
A free puck to the opposing team on the 65m line opposite where the ball crossed the endline
A free puck on the 20m line

question: When a team plays the ball over the sideline, how is play restarted?

options.text: A free puck from the ground to the opposing team at the place where the ball crossed the sideline
A free puck on the 65m line

question: When opposing players play the ball simultaneously over the sideline, or when the officials are not sure which team played the ball last, how is play restarted?

options.text: A free puck to the attacking team at the sideline
The Referee, facing the players, throws in the ball between one player from each team, 13m from the sideline and directly infield from where the ball crossed the sideline
A free puck on the 20m line

question: A ball that strikes a sideline or corner flag shall be treated as having done what?
For a sideline puck, where shall the player taking it place the ball?

options.text: On the sideline at the place indicated by the Line Umpire

question: For a sideline puck or sideline throw-in, what is the minimum distance all other players (except the taker or the two contesting the throw-in) must be from the ball until it is struck or thrown in?
If a player taking a sideline puck fails to strike the ball at the first attempt, what must they do? When may a player from either side approach nearer than 13m?

options.text: Retake from the hand; players may approach after the first attempt
Not delay in making a second attempt; only when the player delays the second attempt may a player from either side approach nearer than 13m
Award a throw-in to the opposition; players may approach immediately
Move the ball 13m infield; players may approach when the ball is placed

question: When play is stopped by the Referee in exceptional circumstances to enable a seriously injured player to be treated or removed, and a team was in possession, how does play resume?

options.text: Throw-in at the position where play was stopped
A free puck to the team in possession from the position where play was stopped, unless play was stopped inside the opponents' 20m line in which case the free is from the 20m line opposite that point
A free puck to the opposing team

question: From a free puck awarded when play was stopped for a seriously injured player (team in possession), may a score be made directly?
When play is stopped for a seriously injured player and neither team is in possession, how does play resume?

options.text: A free puck to the team that had possession last
A throw-in at the position where play was stopped, subject to the provisions in Rule 2.2 Exceptions (v) and (vi)
A free puck from the 20m line

question: If the ball touches any non-player during play (not from a free puck), how is play restarted?

options.text: A free puck to the team that had possession
By throwing in the ball at the place concerned

question: If the ball touches any non-player from a free puck, what happens?

options.text: A throw-in at the place concerned
A free to the opposing team

question: If the ball has been prevented from going over a boundary line by a non-player other than the referee, how is it treated?

options.text: As remaining in play; throw-in at the place concerned
As having crossed the line; the referee shall make the appropriate award
The free or puck-out is retaken
As a foul by the attacking team
